question: Which state got India's first all-woman Post Office Passport Seva Kendra?
explanation: Punjab got India's first all-woman Post Office Passport Seva Kendra. The 192nd POPSK of the country and the first one to be operated by an all-women team is located in Phagwara, Punjab. It was inaugurated by Union Minister Vijay Sampla in the local head Post Office of Phagwara. The Post Office Passport Seva Kendra is part of the central government's initiative for women empowerment. It Aimed at providing facilities related to applying for and processing of passport applications for the people, the POPSK is likely to act as a great support for the town as it is the NRI hub of Doaba region of Punjab.
